intro: Stenactis verna, commonly known as the early violet, is a small herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine pubescence. Stenactis verna blooms from March to May, making it one of the earliest flowering plants of its kind.
